Welcome to Applying CMAB to improve MAPE-K loops’s documentation!¶

CNAE9.CMAB_explore(features, y)¶
Explores the viablity of various CMAB algorithms using the provided features and predictions.

Once it is done exploring it plots out the results of the exploration in a graph for comparison

Parameters:

  • features (numpy array, required) – A numpy array of features

  • y (numpy array, required) – A numpy array of expected predictions

CNAE9.E_greedy(y)¶

Explores the viablity of epsilon greedy selection for this dataset

Parameters:

y (numpy array, required) – A numpy array of expected predictions

Returns:

double that has the percentage of correct guesses

Return type:

double

CNAE9.UCB(y)¶

Explores the viablity of UCB selection for this dataset

Parameters:

y (numpy array, required) – A numpy array of expected predictions

Returns:

double that has the percentage of correct guesses

Return type:

double

CNAE9.clean_data(features, preds)¶

Cleans the provided features and predictions

Parameters:

  • features (list, required) – A list of features

  • preds (list, required) – A list of expected predictions

Returns:

Tuple with the cleaned features and expected predictions of those features

Return type:

Tuple containing a numpy array of numpy arrays of ints and a numpy array of ints

CNAE9.compare(y)¶

Compares the viablity of MAB algorithms on this data set

Parameters:

y (numpy array, required) – A numpy array of expected predictions

CNAE9.get_num_lines(file_path)¶

Gets the number of lines that exists in the file in the provided filepath

Parameters:

file_path (string, required) – A string that provides the file path of the file that needs its lines counted.

Returns:

The number of lines in the file

Return type:

int

CNAE9.parse_data(filename)¶

Extracts the features and predictions from the provided file

Parameters:

filename (string, required) – A string that provides the file path of the file that needs its lines counted.

Returns:

Tuple with the features and expected predictions of those features

Return type:

Tuple containing a list of lists and a list of ints

CNAE9.random_selection(y)¶

Explores the viablity of random selection for this dataset

Parameters:

y (numpy array, required) – A numpy array of expected predictions

Returns:

double that has the percentage of correct guesses

Return type:

double
